Message.Title: Samsung Urges Intel to Launch DDR4 Systems Ahead of Schedule
Message.Msg: Samsung Urges Intel to Launch DDR4 Systems Ahead of Schedule With over-production, swelling-inventories, and cutthroat competition that doesn't allow even subtle price-increases, DDR3 is a lost-cause for DRAM makers such as Samsung. It is hence hedging its bets on the early arrival of DDR4, and the only company that can make that happen is Intel. Samsung is not only a major supplier of DRAM memory, but also a big player in server memory. It had its first DDR4 UDIMM ready as early as in January 2011. Reports of Intel slating DDR4-equipped platforms in 2013 has Samsung perturbed. Samsung and Hynix are the only two DRAM majors with developed DDR4 products. According to DigiTimes' analysis, DRAM vendors see DDR4 as the only way they can pull themselves out of their ailing situation. http://www.techpowerup.com/164134/Samsung-Urges-Intel-to-Launch-DDR4-Systems-Ahead-of-Schedule.html Samsung Samples Industry’s First DDR4 Memory Modules for Servers. Samsung Begins to Sample 16GB DDR4 RDIMMs [07/02/2012 10:10 PM] by Anton Shilov Samsung Electronics has announced that it had begun sampling the industry’s first 16GB registered dual inline memory modules (RDIMMs), designed for use in enterprise server systems. The world's largest maker of dynamic random access memory (DRAM) plans to start making DDR4 modules for servers next year. Samsung currently samples 8GB and 16GB DDR4 memory modules that are based on chips made using 30nm-class process technology and which operate at 1.2V voltage. While Samsung does not directly states clock-speed of memory modules, the company notes that by next year the DDR4 will reach twice the current 1600Mb/s of DDR3 memory, which points to 3.20GHz effective clock-speed. Samsung sampled new 8GB and 16GB DDR4 modules in June, in addition to providing them to major CPU and controller makers. The modules will bring the highest density and performance levels to premium enterprise server systems. Samsung previously introduced the industry’s first 30nm-class 2GB DDR4 module in December, 2010.

Message.Title: Europe's fastest computer (with Intel Inside) switched on
Message.Msg: Europe has turned on the region's most powerful supercomputer. The SuperMUC, ranked fourth in the June TOP500 supercomputing listing, just below Lady Gaga is built around 147,456 cores. The chips are Intel Xeon 2.7-GHz, 8-core E5-2680 chips and the beast has been built by IBM. http://fudzilla.com/home/item/28120-europes-fastest-computer-switched-on

Message.Title: Maybe This Is Good News
Message.Msg: US Fed selling Treasuries maturing 5/2015 thru 9/2015 07/27 08:22 AM NEW YORK, July 27 (Reuters) - The Federal Reserve on Friday was selling on the open market U.S. Treasuries maturing May 2015 through September 2015, the New York Fed said on its website. The Fed previously said it intended to sell $7 billion to $8 billion of short-dated Treasuries on Friday. The sale was part of the Fed's latest stimulus program, dubbed "Operation Twist" - a program that extends the maturity of the central bank's Treasuries holdings in a bid to lower mortgage rates and other long-term borrowing costs. For details, click on http://www.newyorkfed.org/markets/pomo/display/index. (Reporting by Chris Reese; Editing by Eric Walsh)

Message.Title: Facebook rump ramming its shareholders. OUCH
Message.Msg: This company is way way way overvalued as you have all guess by now. It has a market cap of $55 billion, on $1.2b in revenue and $0 profit. That is a higher market cap than Caterpillar (CAT) and CAT made $60b in revenue and a $5b PROFIT. FB is currently valued at more than twice that of Yahoo. FB also has 2.4b shares. That is ridiculous as it took MicroSoft decades to become so bloated. Every 5/share move increases FB's market cap by $12b which is NOT AT ALL reflected in the financials. In comparison Apple has 900m shares outstanding, less than have of FB's float. FB is worth about 5-10/share giving it a market cap of $10-15 billion. You are essentially buying a website and an app. Ask investors from 1999 how buying websites worked out for everyone. And wait until the restricted employee shares go on sale next month. August is when employees are allowed to sell and they would be idiots not to dump their holdings. This could get even worse

Topic.Title: Five Cool Things About Google Fiber

Message.Msg: Big deal. FTTH to deliver TV on demand. Take a look at what BCE is doing. They have FTTH rollout too for TV/internet (that is basically to compete with cable service providers), but they are also streaming TV channels to mobile devices, including the Olympics... on-demand and LIVE. Now THAT'S cool. http://mobiletv.bell.ca/

Topic.Title: Five Cool Things About Google Fiber

Message.Msg: Oh, and you can watch the olympics live and on-demand in high-def free. I watched the 2010 winter games on-demand and it was great. Pick whatever sport you want, excellent quality, very few commercials (at that time anyway), and raw feed without announcers blabbering on. Hope to see the more of the same this time around. http://www.ctvolympics.ca/index.html

Message.Title: Intel presents new smart-phone chips, partnership with ZTE
Message.Msg: Old news right. Here is some new news though. On the upswing, by contrast, was China’s ZTE, which made it into IDC’s Top 5 smartphone vendors for the first time. It did so due to strength in its home market, as well as growth internationally, including in the U.S. where it is shipping under both its own and carrier brands. Also--Apple is feeling hurt from Sammmysung. Samsung shipped about 50.2 million smartphones in the quarter, according to IDC, while Apple sold approximately 26 million iPhones in the quarter. Now given this PAIN from Sammysung onto the Apple boys, you can well assume that Apple is talking with Intel. After all, Samsung is making the Apple chips for phones and tablets and is sticking it to Apple big time on sales at the same time. Look to when Intel opens the new 5 Billion dollar super fab, and you will be in the ballpark as to when it is Apple will switch to Intel as its manufacturer. Intel will even make the Arm based chips for Apple for a time giving Apple time to do the 100% switch over to Intel chips. Motorola announces in just a few months that is is shipping phones with Intel chips. All and all, there seems to be a huge upside from Intel in revenue and net profits. The stock trades as if Intel were a loser clown company, AMD for example, but Intel is kicking buuuuttt and taking no shheit from anyone these days. Like Teddy Roosevelt said, Intel is talking softly and carrying a BIG STICK. Super Fabs coming on line with Chips that will shrink in volume shipments at 14 nm. You might wonder what will happen to Arm and the idiots who make their chips? Who cares? I mean do you wonder about companies from the dotcom bust of 2000? NO Intel will destroy Arm and laugh to the bank in doing so.

Message.Title: INTC new soc game changer
Message.Msg: Intel Corporation (NASDAQ:INTC): Intel Corporation, has clearly been busy. They have announced a new solution which will allow 3G power amplifiers to be directly integrated onto radio frequency circuits. Thanks to this low-power 3G solution, the chip, dubbed the SMARTi UE2p, will help lower the cost of 3G handsets, and will spur the development for the “Internet of Things,” which will enable devices to remain connected. The new SoC is also smaller in size, is more power efficient, and is less complex for developers to work with. Their shares traded up $0.52 (2.04%), they were recently at $26.02.

Message.Title: So which earnings was better? Apple or Intel?
Message.Msg: The only negative sentiment about Intel is how the iPad from Apple is going to cannibalize Intel's PC sales. But what story is earnings telling us in terms of current expectations. Apple missed estimates by 10% while Intel beat estimates by 3.8%. Apple gave guidance lower by 25% of next quarter's estimates while Intel only gave guidance lower by 9% of next quarter's estimates. So things did not look as good as people on average thought of Apple while things did not look as bad as people on the negative side thought of Intel. As for Amazon, that thing makes no sense. Their kindle sales were less than a million, their bargains are not that great anymore, and sales taxes are coming for them soon. Still, they barely make money. Yet investors are still in love with their story. We will see how than goes in the next year or so.
